data.title: Qlik Sense or Power BI: Ultimate Comparison Guide of 2024
data.meta_description: Qlik Sense vs Power BI? Decoding your dilemma by comparing features, differences, pros and cons, and more. Read now & choose the best.
data.text:
Introduction

In our series of comparing robust business intelligence tools of 2024, we last discussed Power BI vs Google Data Studio, and before that, we discussed Power BI vs Tableau.

Advancing to the next fold of our discussion, it’s time to compare another set of powerful BI contenders – Qlik Sense vs Power BI.

Does it make your decision even more difficult?

Worry not!

If you’re on the fence about deciding between Power BI vs Quik Sense, this straight-talk business intelligence platform review is here to help you make an informed decision.

It breaks down Power BI & Qlik Sense, its key features, fundamental differences, and its plus and minuses.

With a bonus: How to decide between Power BI versus Qlik Sense?

Ready to discover, decide, and take action?

Let’s go!

Starting our debate around Qlik Sense vs Power BI — Let’s first get to know our two contenders.

Contact our Power BI Expert

Let’s Start With – What is Power BI?

Microsoft Power BI – an acronym for Power Business Intelligence, is a collection of connectors, apps, and software services that work unitedly to turn disparate data sources into coherent and immersive insights.

Whether your data is – on-premises, in the cloud, on a spreadsheet, or streaming in real time, Power BI’s powerful features and self-explanatory interface empower you to derive hidden insights and make informed business decisions, effortlessly.

Next, in the comparison between Qlik vs Power BI, it’s time to scoop the capabilities of the second contender – Qlik Sense.

What is Qlik Sense?

Qlik Sense is a modern and web-based data analysis platform, representing the 3rd-generation BI technology which means it is the most user-friendly iteration of analytics available, today.

With Qlik Sense, you are empowered with the capability to seamlessly explore, discover, and build compelling stories to present the data across different verticals.

Moreover, its responsive design ensures that your visualizations appear beautiful on every device.

Have you made up your judgment?

Don’t rush your decision just yet.

Both BI platforms are robust in their own right and there is a lot you should consider before investing in one.

Next, in decoding your dilemma between Qlik Sense vs Power BI, we will zoom into the important aspects that will take you closer to your decision.

Let’s get going.

What is Power BI Used for?

Power BI is used by businesses large, small, and medium to –

Gather real-time insights

Make sense of complicated data

Extend business intelligence value with AI and ML

Identify trend patterns

Set up automation

Perform online analytical processing

Conduct Ad hoc analysis and reporting

Utilize complete reporting and data visualization toolset

Engage with the Q&A question box

Accelerate decision making

What is Qlik Sense Used For?

Qlik Sense is primarily used by medium and large sized-businesses to –

Empower their teams with self-service analytics and visualizations

Create interactive dashboards

Utilize search and conversational analytics

Set up alerts and automation

Generate reports

Customize and embed analytics

Perform real-time analytics

Integrate with Big data sources

Utilize a rapid development environment

Access standard APIs

Collaborate on reports and dashboards

Long story short: Both Power BI and Qlik Sense equip robust business intelligence capabilities and empower businesses to understand, visualize, and share data through different approaches.

Realize that in the tug-of-war between Qlik Sense vs Power BI, the latter aims for businesses of all sizes, with mixed budgets, and requires no strong proficiency, while the prior BI platform caters to medium and large enterprises with bigger data storage needs and calls for proficient data professionals.

When we compared the leading business intelligence tools Qlik vs Tableau vs Power BI, here is what we found.

Source: Enlyft

Moving on, it’s time to dive deeper, into the face-off of Microsoft Power BI vs Qlik Sense, nail down their features, and help you find “the one” for your BI needs.

Qlik Sense vs Power BI Features Comparison

Now, it’s time to explore the side-by-side differences between Qlik Sense vs Power BI and discover which BI platform deserves your vote.

What are the Major Differences Between Qlik Sense and Power BI?

As leading business intelligence tools, both Microsoft Power BI and Qlik Sense share the ultimate goal of empowering businesses to unlock actionable insights from their data.

Yet both tools share primary differences between their underlying ecosystems and technologies.

Qlik Sense and Power BI – Here are the Differences

1. Power BI vs Qlik Sense: Vendor and Ecosystem

Microsoft Power BI offers effortless integration with other Microsoft product offerings such as Azure, and MS Power Platform along with non-Microsoft product ranges such as Google Sheets, SalesForce, etc.

Created by Qlik, Qlik Sense is a standalone business intelligence product.

Although Qlik doesn’t share the same level of integration with Microsoft’s product range, it offers standard integration connectivity to a variety of data sources including spreadsheets, data warehouses, cloud-based platforms, and many more.

If your business is heavily invested in Microsoft ecosystem Power BI is your best choice.

2. Qlik Sense vs Power BI: Storage Capacity

Power BI provides cloud storage from 10 GB to 100 TB depending on your subscription plan.

Whereas Qlik Sense provides 500 GB of cloud storage.

Whatever data storage capabilities your business intelligence initiative demands, MS PowerBI may be the best bet as you can choose from different subscription plans flexibly.

3. Power BI versus Qlik Sense: Visualization and User-Interface

Power BI is known for its user-friendly features and self-explanatory interface.

Many users find it easy to learn, especially when compared to complex business intelligence tools such as Tableau or Qlik Sense.

On the flip side, Qlik Sense is also an easy-to-use, clean, modern BI tool that empowers users from all backgrounds to learn and interact with data.

Nonetheless, in this category of Qlik Sense vs Power BI debate, Microsoft Power BI offers quicker and better custom data visualizations.

4. MS Power BI vs Qlik Sense: Supported Devices

Power BI supports Windows, Android, and iOS devices.

If you must maintain your data on-premises, you need to get the special version of the Desktop app called Power BI Desktop for Power BI Report Server.

Qlik Sense also shares seamless compatibility with the latest iOS versions, Windows, Android, and web-based platforms. For your on-premises reporting needs, you need to install Qlik Sense Enterprise on Prem

Decoding your dilemma of Microsoft Power BI vs Qlik Sense, device compatibility plays a significant role and both BI tools offer extensive support for various devices.

5. Qlik Sense vs Power BI: Reporting

Both Power BI and QlikSense offer robust reporting capabilities.

Creating and distributing reports in MS Power BI is both easy and rewarding for all users from diverse technical backgrounds thanks to Power BI’s drag-and-drop interface and self-explanatory features.

Qlik, on the other hand, empowers users to create detailed reports by incorporating charts and graphs.

The winner of this category is subjective and depends on your business’s specific reporting and distributing preferences.

6. Qlik vs Power BI: Mobile App

For iOS and Android, Power BI and Qlik Sense both provide mobile apps with responsive design and offline access.

Users may view reports and dashboards on their mobile devices with ease ensuring cutting-edge data protection and support for real-time collaboration.

Power BI Mobile App is best used to monitor and access your Power BI data on the go.

Whether the data is on-premises or in the cloud, you may view and interact with all Power BI reports and dashboards, share them with your team and discover insights within minutes.

Qlik Sense also walks in with a Qlik Sense Mobile SaaS app for iOS and Android mobile devices that allows users who have been allocated User access, or a Professional or Analyzer access license to connect while restricting anonymous access.

Both the BI platforms Power BI and Qlik Sense pose equal competition when it comes to providing mobile accessibility and protecting data while supporting real-time collaboration. Thus, the winner of this bracket depends on your business preference and additional features.

7. Qlik vs Power BI: Pricing

Lastly, in the discussion around Qlik Sense vs Power BI, we have the biggest deciding factor – Pricing.

Connect with our Experts

The prize winner of this category is Power BI due to its flexible pricing options and straightforward pricing model.

Whereas QlikSense comes with a complicated token pricing model, making Power BI a cost-effective and user-friendly choice for many businesses.

Dig deeper: Find Your Fit by Learning Power BI Cost, Benefits, and More.

Phew! That was quite a comparison between Qlik Sense vs Power BI.

This in-depth Power BI vs Qlik Sense comparison will move you close to your decision.

Moving on, it’s time to explore the pluses and minuses of the BI tools in question.

Exploring the Pros and cons of Power BI vs Qlik Sense

Whether your gut feeling says Power BI or Qlik Sense, exploring the good and bad of each tool will provide you with a clearer perspective, allowing you to make an informed decision without solely relying on your intuition.

Let’s get going.

Pros and Cons of Qlik Sense

Pros and cons of Power BI

This was all about the Qlik Sense vs Power BI differences that you should be aware of before arriving at your decision.

Now it’s time to clear the air around the dilemma…

How to Decide Between Power BI vs Qlik Sense in 2024?

There is no one-word answer to this question.

In 2024, Microsoft Power BI and Qlik Sense stand at the forefront of the business intelligence and data visualization industry, offering a myriad of perks that solidify their positions as leaders in the industry.

After carefully assessing these factors, you’ll have a thoughtful answer to the question – “Which BI tool fits best for my organization’s BI needs?”

Impressed with the capabilities of Microsoft’s Power BI, have you decided to opt for it?

Cheers!

We are happy to have helped you arrive at your best judgment.

Do you want to make the most of Power BI effortlessly?

It’s ideal to partner with a Power BI consulting and implementation services provider and leverage their expertise.

This blog is brought to you by Integrative Systems, a reputed Power BI consulting services provider and certified Microsoft Partner based out of Chicago, USA.

With our proven expertise in maximizing the capabilities of Power BI for businesses large and small, we would be happy to help you achieve your business intelligence goals.

Have questions for us?

Reach out to us at [email protected] and our team of experts will get back to you within 2 business days.

Frequently Asked Questions about Microsoft Power BI vs Qlik Sense – Data Visualization

1. Is Power BI Better Than Qlik?

Power BI is better than Qlik Sense in multiple ways. Such as – Cost-effectiveness, ease of use, flexible pricing model, variety of customization options, and much more. However, Qlik Sense has its own advantages such as bigger cloud storage and an associative-based data engine.

2. Is Qlik Sense Good or Bad?

Qlik Sense is a powerful data visualization tool. It’s a good choice for businesses seeking a flexible and customizable tool with self-service analytical capabilities. However, it may not be an ideal choice for businesses seeking flexible data extraction capabilities, a simplified token pricing model, and seamless integration with Microsoft product range.

4. What is the Best Data Visualization Tool?

Microsoft Power BI is the best data visualization tool, meeting all the requirements of an ideal data visualization tool in 2024.
